One point to both teams in the Women's 2's Hockey

James thirds dumped out in controversial circumstances

Alcuin seconds look set to push Wentworth firsts all the way for the runners-up spot in Group A, but their 3-0 win against James thirds on Thursday was earned with the aid of some dubious refereeing (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Maggie Aslet)

Grayland brace fires Goodricke into the quarters

Two goals from Chris Grayland handed Goodricke victory over Wentworth firsts and sent them into the quarter-finals of the college cup. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Maggie Aslet)

Langwith take step towards quarter-finals but Halifax seconds stay in reach

There is fierce competition for the two qualification spots in Group D, with Langwith and Halifax seconds both strengthening their chances today. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

Halifax, James and Alcuin set the standard as College Cup heats up

Some say that the World Cup is the highlight of the summer's sporting calendar but, for the moment, all eyes at York are fixed firmly on the College Cup (Thumbnail credit Simon Mole, of James, goes for goal in his side's 2-0 win over Goodricke seconds)

College Cup 2010: Your team-by-team guide

Two weeks into the tournament of the summer, the <em>Nouse</em> sports team run the rule over all eight colleges, identifying those indispensible players, ubiquitous BNOCs and all-round hotties

No scope for upsets in the sun

The Mixer thinks maybe it's destined for higher things. Having played pretty well in recent five-a-sides TM fancies its chances of shoring up York City's defence next year, as they face another year in the Conference (Thumbnail credit Halifax scored their sixth and I just... CHUNDERED EVERYWHERE)

The University of York Canoe Polo Club

Two years ago, Canoe Polo had no budget, no players and was stigmatised by its own ranks, but now the sport is one of the coolest on campus. Sports Editor Adam Shergold takes to the water (Thumbnail credit The open canoe polo match at Roses, which finished 2-2, will stick in the memory of all present, Photo: Sam Newsome)

Six uncontested positions have made a sham of the York Sport elections

I'm no psychic, but I could have told you the results of the York Sport Committee elections long before Friday's official unveiling of Team Asfahani (Thumbnail credit Cesca Dessain, of Netball and Fusion fame, is the new York Sport Events Officer, Photo: Peter Iveson)

Derwent get the job done as Vanbrugh seconds bounce back

Derwent looked a shadow of last year's semi-finalists on Monday, but they earned their first win against Vanbrugh thirds. Afterwards, Vanbrugh seconds beat Wentworth seconds 4-1 (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

YUsnow hold their own in British Universities' Main Event

By James Bithell

YUsnow performed admirably against high standards of competition at the British Universities Snowsports Council 'Main Event' (Thumbnail credit Steph Campbell-Woodward finished 13th in the slalom, 17th in the Giant Slalom and 5th ski cross. Photograph courtesy BUSC Media Crew)

Double disappointment for Vanbrugh as Alcuin and Wentworth cash in

Two 3-1 results today in Group C of the College Cup as Alcuin firsts hit the top and Wentworth seconds started their campaign in style (Thumbnail credit Alcuin's Joe Cooper was in hot form on Friday. Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Halifax and Vanbrugh produce College Cup goal flood

Halifax hit a depleted Langwith seconds for six in the first of today's Group B double header, but Vanbrugh went one better, thrashing Goodricke thirds 7-0. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Six uncontested positons in York Sport Committee elections

Treasurer will be the only contested position in this year's York Sport Committee elections as the team working with Sam Asfahani takes shape

Derwent Seconds bounce back as Goodricke roll on

In Tuesday's Group A fixtures, Derwent Seconds reignited their campaign with a 3-0 win over James Thirds, before Goodricke Firsts beat Alcuin Seconds by the same scoreline (Thumbnail credit Sam Lewis scored Goodricke's opener against Alcuin with one of the goals of the tournament so far. Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle.)

Johnson shines again for James as Langwith earn winning start

Mark Johnson's brace was enough for James to see off the challenge of Goodricke seconds in Monday's Group D clashes, before Langwith firsts beat Derwent thirds 3-1 (Thumbnail credit Dave Coupland rushes across to try and dispossess Mark Johnson during this afternoon's James-Goodricke clash. Photograph by Maggie Aslet)

College Rugby remembers Charles de Ladoucette

James and a College Barbarians XV delivered an entertaining game of rugby on Sunday in memory of Charles de Ladoucette, the James player who died just over a year ago (Thumbnail credit Giles Welford in possession for James during Sunday's match. Photograph by Maggie Aslet)

UYBC clean up at Tees Regatta

As they enter the summer Regatta season, there was encouragement for pretty much every York University Boat Club crew at the Tees Regatta this weekend (Thumbnail credit York's senior women's IM2 crew neck and neck with Tyne in their race. Photograph courtesy UYBC)

Goal glut for Goodricke seconds as Vanbrugh teams tie

Goodricke seconds hit Derwent thirds for six as College Cup Group D got underway, while Vanbrugh seconds required a last-minute equaliser to spare their blushes against the thirds (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Johnson-inspired James send message to rivals

Two goals from Mark Johnson sealed an impressive win for James firsts this afternoon against a solid Halifax seconds side. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

The Nouse Sports Podcast

By James Bithell

This week's Sports Podcast features Adam Shergold, Leigh Clarke, Henry Cowen, Jake Farrell and Derwent captain Matt Hallam on the College Cup, Roses, the Premier League and the provisional England squad (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Maggie Aslet)

Alcuin signal their intentions by beating Derwent

Alcuin issued a statement that they intend to retain the College Cup, as goals from Miles McDermott, Dan Cox and a Dom Henney own goal delivered a 3-1 win over Derwent (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Maggie Aslet)

Halifax hit eight as James seconds suffer shock

Halifax opened up their college cup account in style after handing out a lesson to lowly Goodricke thirds, as Langwith seconds beat James seconds. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Maggie Aslet)

Goodricke and Wentworth open College Cup accounts

Goodricke and Wentworth firsts were forced to work hard in the opening round of College Cup Group A fixtures today, but eventually prevailed against James thirds and Derwent seconds respectively (Thumbnail credit Dave Coupland celebrates one of his two goals in Goodricke's 3-0 win against James thirds today. Photograph by Peter Iveson )

Positive start to Regatta season for Boat Club

By James Bithell

While the rest of the university's sportsmen and women were at Roses, the Boat Club excelled at Nottingham in the first BUCS Regatta of the season (Thumbnail credit The Senior Men's Crew at Nottingham. Photograph courtesy UYBC)

The College Cup: Nouse's definitive guide

With less than a week remaining to the start of the College Cup, David Ambrozejczyk previews everyone's favourite college competition. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Arran Bowen-la Grange)

Lancaster gain their perfect revenge

It transpires last year's 115-point humiliation smarted much more than we ever imagined. For twelve months, the sportsmen and women of Lancaster have been licking their wounds, plotting and scheming, counting down to the opportunity to enact delicious revenge (Thumbnail credit Brave performance by women's basketball. Photo: Sam Newsome)

Tournament Highlights

By James Bithell

Best club, Best player, Best match, Funniest Moment

Controversial officiating denies YUsnow clean sweep on the slopes

The final score over at Rossendale on Friday evening read York 10 Lancaster 2 as YUsnow once again left behind a trail of disheartened Lancastrians in the ski and snowboard events, despite having very little training on dry slopes since Christmas (Thumbnail credit Tom Farrow completes his run in the snowboard event, although York were forced to share the spoils after Lancaster appealed. Image: Courtesy of YUsnow)

Firsts prevail in indoor football

Two goals from Conor Brennan helped the men's firsts Indoor Football side secure York's first points of the day with a 4-2 victory in a hotly contested clash (Thumbnail credit Lancaster on the offensive in their 5-1 men's thirds triumph. Photo: Peter Iveson)

Lancaster take control in the pool

Both of York's swimming teams were comfortably beaten on Roses weekend, yet the men's and women's teams can both take heart that they performed admirably against a much stronger force (Thumbnail credit Photo: George Lowther)
